review.reviewBody: I always wore the Lululemon Align Joggers, so I’m glad to have found these, which are the same fit, but more comfortable. Love the fabric and color options and they’re TTS. Being almost 5’10”, I’d love to have the option to order them in a longer version, but they’re not horribly cropped on me like so many other pants are.
review.name: Comfy & Easy

review.reviewBody: These joggers are the best! Stylish to run around in and comfy for home. Love the green color and quality!
review.name: Super cute and super soft!

review.reviewBody: Ok these joggers could be my new addiction. The fabric is like butter, but thick enough to be a little more than leggings, and such a cute cut. My husband even noticed how nice they are! That’s saying a lot! I got them in a beautiful dark green, and I will likely get another pair soon.
review.name: The best joggers

review.reviewBody: My fifth jogger and I spend most of my time in them.
review.name: My fifth jogger and I

review.reviewBody: I want to wear these everyday and have tried other brands and returned them b/c I don’t like them as much. I’m about 125-130lbs but like the Med.
review.name: I want to wear these

review.reviewBody: After I bought the black I went back for the navy. Comfortable and great fit!
review.name: Love this jogger

review.reviewBody: I love these pants bc they last forever. The last time I purchased the joggers, prior to this pair, was in 2021. Unfortunately this pair runs smaller than all of my other pairs. They are shorter in length and also tighter. I’m keeping them but not as in love with these pants as prior joggers I purchased.
review.name: Not the same cut

review.reviewBody: I bought the spruce green and the color is beautiful. The softness is so cozy and the fit his nice. Glad I bought them.
review.name: Soft

review.reviewBody: So soft, cozy, yet lightweight, fit like another layer of skin in this most stunning, stunning color!
review.name: So soft, cozy, yet lightweight,

review.reviewBody: Love how soft and comfy these are. They are warm pants without being bulky. I definitely want to make it to their store at some point to try on all their clothing. Beyond yoga is my new favorite clothing company. I love how all the clothes I have tried on are well made with quality fabric.
review.name: Love how soft and comfy

review.reviewBody: I love the feel of these grips, but within a few rides the end cap has completely broken (without any crashes, etc), and the end of the grip is torn off. Bummer, I wouldn't recommend these.
review.name: Comfy, but not durable

review.reviewBody: The grips are comfortable and the color matches my Ibis Ripmo perfectly. Most recently I rode the CAMBA trails (Northern WI) in hot humid July weather and could only ride without gloves for a short period of time before my sweaty hands were starting to slip. Once I put my gloves on it was time to get rowdy and send it again. If you ride without gloves consistently you may want to check out the factory version. These are good for me since it doesn't stay hot and humid for long here and I generally wear light gloves most of the riding season.
review.name: Get a Grip on it

name: GE1 Evo Grips

review.reviewBody: Disappointed!  I purchased as a Christmas gift for my husband.  He has the previous version of the Endura Windchill Jacket that fits perfectly in Men's Large and was his favorite jacket for many years.  This model jacket is so tiny it appears to be for a child.  The material does not stretch and he was not able to get his arm through the sleeve.  I am a woman's medium and was able to put it over my arms but could not zip it.  Something is seriously wrong with the sizing of this jacket.  Now I have to pay to ship it back.  Not happy that my husband does not have a present.
review.name: Men's Large was too small

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’11” and weigh 182 lbs. I ordered the. l and L and could’ve gone with either.  I kept the XL which is very slightly large but still fits nicely with a long sleeve summer jersey underneath. It fits better with a thicker fall/winter long sleeve base layer.  The L would’ve been slightly restrictive as I have larger arms (not pencil cyclist arms and not body builder arms, just average) The build quality, material and attention to detail is superior to many manufacturers and on par IMO to ASSOS, Rapha etc. at a fraction of the cost.  My only knock is the color schemes or aesthetics. Not the best designs out there.  I use this jacket for road riding and actually the high vis yellow and grey isn’t a bad looking jacket at all.  Important to me is to be undeniably visible to motorist and the yellow is definitely high visibility
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: Performs well in NYC winter weather. Run's small so buy a size up. Quality product for a good price and would recommend.
review.name: NYC Battle Tested

review.reviewBody: Winter riding is upon us. Here in northern Alabama morning temps can range from -5 degrees to 40 degrees F, so adaptability is vital. In temps at 20 degrees F this is the outer shell of three layers and keeps everything warm, provides a nice fit, and allows enough movement for road riding. It is tight, but not uncomfortably so. It does really well at keeping the wind at bay and the core warm, which is really the toughest part of the ride. It's a keeper.
review.name: Everything I Need

review.reviewBody:
After reading the measurements I bought a Medium size but found it odd.
Fits like a long sleeve jersey but the fabric is very thick. The forearms actually cut my blood circulation and I would not be able to wear anything under this. It also felt very short and restrictive.
Not sure a Large would be the solution or would actually be too loose around the waste since the proportions seem off for me.
Odd ball for sure. 
I still love Competitive Cyclist :)
review.name: Weird?

name: Windchill Jacket II - Men's

description: Buy the BOTE ZEPPELIN AERO Inflatable Kayak - 2022 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ZEPPELIN AERO Inflatable Kayak - 2022
hasVariant.description: Buy the BOTE ZEPPELIN AERO Inflatable Kayak - 2022 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] kayak arrived quickly and made for a great Christmas gift! currently waiting for the weather to warm up so she can use it!
review.name: Christmas!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Finally got a chance to take this out on a local lake. It was awesome. I am not a good balancer or swimmer so have been worried about how I would feel floating around. It was amazing, I could have stayed out on the lake all day. I also love that I can practice standing as if it were a paddle board. The kayak itself feels sturdy and dependable. It is a bit heavier than i thought it would be, but nothing compared to my husbands sit upon kayak.
review.name: Comfortable and Sturdy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The BOTE kayaks are amazing! I have one and I had to buy my husband one. They are so easy to transport and are so comfortable.
review.name: Best Inflatable Kayak Ever!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my first kayak and I'm very happy with the quality and sturdiness. Was easy to inflate and deflate! I'll be using this often. The best part is all the accessories like the cooler, tumbler, rack that all fit together for a fun day on the water!
review.name: This is my first kayak

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wish I bought it earlier in the season. Very sturdy and very comfortable.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have really enjoyed my Kayak so far! Its super easy to inflate (I use an electric pump) and fits nicely back into the bag when I am done. The seat is maybe not the most comfortable but I not a big deal. It’s been a great addition to my fishing adventures!
review.name: Love my Kayak!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve only used the kayak once since purchasing it, but I can already say that the experience was positive. The kayak is stable, maneuverable, and the seat is comfortable. The only downside is that the kayak is very heavy for me; I wouldn’t be able to carry it to the water by myself, so I had to ask my husband for help.
review.name: I’ve only used the kayak

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased two of these for times when hauling traditional hard kayaks isn’t possible. Typical Bote quality. We’ve had a couple Bote Aero SUP that have been great and knew when it was time to purchase an inflatable kayak we’d buy Bote. If you’re looking for a quality affordable inflatable kayak you’ve found your Bote!
review.name: Excellent inflatable kayak

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It feels very stable in the water. The front and back end bumper tips will prevent scraping or punctures. Love the magnetic mug port on the floor to hood you mug securely to the floor. The seat is very comfortable along with the upright position. It feels very durable. The included backpack to store everything is fantastic.
review.name: Very well thought out design.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really fun, easy to inflate, a little tougher to store. It sits high, wonder if there is a lower seat you can get to make it more stable. My fault for having bad balance due to a back fusion. Still is fun and cant wait to get back out.
review.name: Really Fun and Easy

name: ZEPPELIN AERO Inflatable Kayak - 2022

review.reviewBody: i expected this to be thick since it says the warmest down coat.... it came in just ok, a little bit thin...this probably just barely enough for Chicago winter when it's sub 20f

comment: Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our product. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: My family loves Marmot coats. We all have at least 2, and have purchased this brand over the years because of its reliably warm coats for Northern winters. However, this iteration of the Monteaux Kids down coat is thin and is missing some of the warmth. I’m not sure what the makers were attempting to achieve, but it isn’t 100% to our liking as other purchases have been. The next time we need a coat for our kids, we may look to other brands to open our options toward better quality.
review.name: Good but Wish the Original was Available

hasVariant.name: Pro Mechanic HD Bicycle Repair Stand
hasVariant.description: Buy the Feedback Sports Pro Mechanic HD Bicycle Repair Stand online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Pro Mechanic HD Bicycle Repair Stand
review.reviewBody: I do regular maintenance on a 50 lb ebike and previously had a good Feedback stand that required a lot of care to avoid toppling over. The Pro Mechanic HD works great—is much beefier and sturdier, and supports the bike with great stability. All parts are high quality and work well. The clamp is excellent— solid, strong, easy to clamp and to release. For its size and strength  it is lightweight and easy to move around. Expensive but you get what you pay for. Doubt I’ll ever need another repair stand.
review.name: Great stand as advertised

name: Pro Mechanic HD Bicycle Repair Stand

description: Buy the SRAM X01 2.1 Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: X01 2.1 Rear Derailleur
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM X01 2.1 Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this derailleur to replace a 4-year old very-loved X01 that I broke. Replacement was simple, b-limit adjustment wasn't hard after finding the correct spacing on Sram's spec sheet. Shifting is precise, especially with Shimano's SP41 and replacement of the rest of the drivetrain components at the same time. I am using an X01 cassette, chain,  and a Wolf Tooth elliptical 30T chainring. Has not caused me any issues yet, so I am happy with the performance. My only wish is for the older 11-speed design to be reduced in price, seeing that the industry has shifted to 12-speed.
review.name: Works great, but expensive

name: X01 2.1 Rear Derailleur

description: Buy the Mountain House Creamy Macaroni & Cheese online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Creamy Macaroni & Cheese
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Creamy Macaroni & Cheese online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This would be more appropriately called "cheese soup with macaroni".   I would have preferred a little less soup and a lot more macaroni.
review.name: Soupy cheese

review.reviewBody: I ate the Mac & cheese just out of curiosity. I followed the directions & let it sit for the amount of time the pouch said, stirred it & let it sit more. I tried a bite and it was still a little crunchy, so I let it sit for about 5 more minutes than the instructions said. It was still crunchy, but edible. Overall the taste is great. I bought several pouches for my husband to keep in his get home bag in his semi. I think they’ll be fine if he ever needs them.
review.name: Very tasty but a little crunchy

review.reviewBody: My wife and I tried this and while we thought the flavor was fine we both thought the noodles needed much more time to rehydrate.  I waited the initial 5 minutes, stirred waited another 4 minutes per the instructions and found them to be tough. In the end, I waited 20 minutes and while better still could have used more time.  Yes, the water was boiling but I admit not a rapid boil.  Next time, I get a rapid boil going and see if that makes a difference.
review.name: Good Flavor, more time needed for rehydration

review.reviewBody: The lasagna is the best. Macaroni, very good. I have also bought and enjoyed the blueberry crisp. Delicious for breakfast.
review.name: I am yet to have a bad meal.

review.reviewBody: Excellent flavor. Texture was better than expected. I had never tried dehydrated meals before. Bought more and will use in the future.
review.name: Mac and Cheese - pleasantly surprised

review.reviewBody: Like most Mtn House products, easy to make in the puch (I admittingly will use a tiny bit less water to keep it from being too soupy in some products).  The Mac and Cheese tastes good as a stand alone, but I often add some black pepper+bacon bits or cajun seasoning that works well too.
review.name: Overall tastes good, easy to make

review.reviewBody: I love Mountain House Meals but I tried Macaroni and Cheese for the second time (following the precise instructions) and the noodles are crunchy. They don't cook right.
review.name: Crunchy Noodles

review.reviewBody: The macaroni would not fully rehydrate. I followed instructions,  and even let it sit longer than required.  Half the macaroni was still solid, while the other half were the right consistency. Ended up dumping it out in the woods. On a positive note, a bear came along and enjoyed it.
review.name: Had plenty of cheese sauce, but....

review.reviewBody: Backpacking in Yellowstone, Macaroni and Cheese hit the spot!
review.name: Great meal in the backcountry

review.reviewBody: Had this for lunch one day on a backcountry hunt. Very good! I competed the meal with some peanut butter crackers and had plenty of energy for the rest of the day. Follow the directions or all of the noodles may not cook. Ask me how I know! Very pleased with all of the MH products I have used.
review.name: Easy to make, real Mac and Cheese

name: Creamy Macaroni & Cheese

hasVariant.name: CNC Drive Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne CNC Drive Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: See the other reviews about how the convoluted head removes valve stems.  I finally pulled the head off this and stuck a Silca chuck and hose adapter on this for just $60 more and now it works well. Obviously you should get a Silca Pista and skip the extra steps.
review.name: Looks great but severely annoying

review.reviewBody: This isn't easy to thread on, and when it does it often removes the valve stem when you take it off.  I've had it too long to return so I'm just going back to flip type pumps.  It is a total waste of money
review.name: Great tool to remove valve stems

review.reviewBody: I've been using this pump for almost a year now. It works about 50% of the time. It is so frustrating to buy a higher end pump and have it cause more problems then solutions. The last time I used it the presta valve came off my bike. This is not a user friendly pump. I don't recommend it if you want an easy to use off the shelf product. I have three bikes and ride almost everyday, so I am not a "once in a while" rider.
review.name: Terrible Pump

review.reviewBody:
First off... don't buy this pump, there are way to many other good options.

The only problem (and it's a big one) is the head. When the pump works.. it works great. But, it can be difficult to attach if you're in a hurry or your valve is a little grimy. Once it is attached, there is always this first pump where the gauge goes way up, then it feels like a seal breaks and the air equalizes between tire and pump... I've learned to live with that. 

What I can't live with is that if your valve cores are not tightened down with pliers, this pump with remove your core EVERY TIME. There is nothing more frustrating than when you think you're about to jump on the trail and then all the air comes rushing out of your tube or tire. The only reason I didn't throw this pump off a bridge out of anger is that I never lost a bead the few times this happened. 

It's just a bad design on an expensive pump which is inexcusable. I don't know why I keep buying Lezyne products. They suck....  I think they make stuff for people who don't really ride bikes or work on them, and just think they are trendy.
review.name: Great valve core remover... bad pump

name: CNC Drive Floor Pump

review.reviewBody: The Peregrines can and have done it all for me.  Except maybe slippery mud.  Superb at trail running but on a recent 3 week adventure in Seattle/BC they were also my road runners, hiking shoes, and cruising all the museums & markets shoes.  Excellent traction, good cushion & comfort, feel reasonably responsive, and no black toe.  Smoother feeling on pavement than I expected.
review.name: One Shoe Many Uses

review.reviewBody: Great fit and lightweight. Excellent grip on any surface. Only problem is durability, the side fabric on both shoes tore fairly quickly. Had to throw them away after not that many miles because they became unbearable once the fabric developed holes.
review.name: Great shoe but not durable

review.reviewBody: I’ve done 5 runs in them and they are great. I like the idea toes are coved.  This helps with running in the snow.

I bought this shoe size 12 but had to return it and requested a 12.5 and it's perfect. The return process is basically effortless, no hassle whatsoever. I'm new to Saucony this yr. So far I've bought 3 different styles.my feet have never been so happy
review.name: Returns
comment: Thanks for the great feedback, Nicarao! We love happy feet!

review.reviewBody: Fabulous shoes that are contributing to my love of running!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Took these out for a short 5 mile trail run. First time I ever got blisters on the heels from a pair of Saucony shoes. Will give them another try but a tad worried.
review.name: First time
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback.

review.reviewBody: 5th pair of peregrines. Lace eyelets are improved from previous version. Nice toe box and perfect cushioning without being too soft.
review.name: Great trail shoe

review.reviewBody: Bealls (where I bought the shoes) refused to make things right. Happily and thankfully Saucony stepped up to the plate and really went above and beyond. While I had to be extremely diligent, the end result was satisfying.
review.name: Saucony to the rescue

review.reviewBody: The peregrine 14s regular shoe strings are a vast improvement over the quick tie technology of the peregrine 13. I love the tread pattern! I can use them for road running or turf. After 2 decades of long and short distance running these are my favorite.
review.name: Love the tread!

review.reviewBody: I bought the Peregine 14's for a trip my wife & I were taking and was 100% pleased with them.  No break in was needed & the provided excellent grip and stability.
review.name: Great trail shoe

name: Peregrine 14 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Quality is really nice but I ordered the medium and should have gotten the large. Medium will barley fit a 29" tube and tire levers and one small CO2 . If you are hoping to fit just phone and keys medium is will just make it, anything more go with the large.
review.name: Quality is good

review.reviewBody: Evoc is a brand I trust so it was very disappointing to have a bad experience with this seat bag. The size is perfect for a tube, cartridge, two tire levers, a multi tool, bacon strips, inflator, and derailleur hangar. Beyond that however, the zipper is difficult to open and even more difficult to close and the “water repellent” feature is far from “water proof.” The bag and all contents were soaked when I was caught in a heavy rain storm. I’m looking for another bag.
review.name: Very disappointing

review.reviewBody: I can fit my bike tool, keys, phone, 1-3 snacks, wallet, and a small first aid pouch or co2 kit in this bag all at once. The loops on the bottom are a great attachment point for some velcro straps, when I can fold up a lightweight jacket and strap it to the bottom of the bag on those cool mornings that turn into hot afternoons. Bag doesn't sway around much, and haven't had any issues with the velcro straps rubbing on my legs.
review.name: Excellent seat bag

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great if you have a wider foot, I tried in a lot of climbing shoes and found these to work best for my foot shape. I even bought a 2nd pair so I can have a pair while one is being re-soled.
review.name: Great fitting shoes for wider feet

review.reviewBody: Came from using Solutions. With the extra strap, you can tighten down Otaki's more on your foot. Similar aggressive toe. Only reason it didn't get 5 stars is that I don't love the tongue on the shoe. Solutions are easier to slip on and fit more like a sock while with Otakis, there is a tongue that can get folded over.
review.name: Great shoes - Solution Competitor

review.reviewBody: I just received the shoes in the mail and was psyched to open it and try it out. But, upon opening, to my surprise, the shoes looked dirty. Upon closer inspection, there is glue residue on the strap, toe looks like it was poorly glued on or even previously used. There are ends of the stitching sticking out everywhere. I’m sure the material shouldn’t be too bad for climbing but man am I disappointed with the build quality for not so cheap pair of climbing shoes. Hopefully it lasts at least a year of indoor climbing.
review.name: Build Quality is Mediocre at Best

review.reviewBody:
I have been climbing for some time and I am very very hard on shoes. I gym climb 3-4 times a week and tend to press against walls when sport climbing to get rests in between holds so I wear the big toe a lot. I say this because I have had these shoes for over a year, and in that time I have actually had 4 pairs and resoled two of them already. So I have really put this product through the wringer. I go through shoes way faster than most and tend to resole early to not wear out the rand. 

Pros: if you are looking for an aggressive shoe with structure that is still comfortable, these should be a definite consideration. The semi split sole is great for some give in the shoe because is heel and toe box can flex independently. However, the thickness of the toe box rubber and the midsole provide you with a lot of support. The use of edge rubber is also a plus. All these things combined make it a good edging shoe because you have the structure beneath your foot to give you confidence. 

They are down turned but not very asymmetrical. This means that your foot is not jammed in a shoe that concentrates all your power aggressively towards your big toe. I also have sportiva solution shoes and if you compare the two lasts, they are totally different. The lack of asymmetry means that you are in a more relaxed position when on your toe. This is good for longer sessions on the wall, and definitely mean a more comfortable fit. You can definitely wear these for a long time. It also means that people with slightly wider toe box needs can wear them. 

Velcro is good. Traditionalists love laces, and they are great for the shoes that have them, but for ease of on off, the two straps are great and allow for a good deal of adjustment. 

They break in great. Stiff out of the box, but confirm well (but all good climbing shoes do this). The man made leather and full lining means these do not stretch that much, but like any shoe they do stretch a little. Snug initial fit is a good thing. Try them on and beat in mind that about a full  to half a size down is likely required. 

Cons: be aware that the toe patch is basically non existent. These are more of a sport climbing shoe. If you are going to aggressively toe hook and boulders, may not be the best for long term use. The bits of rubber there are ok, and being fully lined they are comfortable to toe hook, but the shoe wasn’t made for that. 

All man made leather gets stinky after a while. It’s just a fact. Deal with it. Real leather tends to deal better with stink. 

Like all shoes, if you beat the heck out of them, they will soften up. I feel as if these become better for feel as they get softer. My resoled shoes are really soft by this point. Really nice for technical moves, but the edging performance has gone down. Again, this is a normal thing for downturned shoes. If you want an edging shoe that will always be stiff, then you want a flat last hard rubber shoe made for that. It isn’t that these puppies  can’t edge, just that as they evolve, so does their edging performance 

Sizing:
I wear street shoe size 42. I have bought these in 41.5 (ended up being a bit too big) two pairs of 41 (just right for all day use) and a pair in 40.5 (Best for hardest sends). If I had to pick 1 all around size for me, I would go with the 41 (again street shoe size 42). 

I have resoled the 41.5 and a pair of the 41. (Rock and resole out of Colorado is an awesome place for resoles). They resole well and are like an old friend, but use a reputable place as I have had cobblers ruin some shoes before.

They are comfy, an amazing performer (a combo that isn’t easy to achieve) and they look good. If you are looking for an aggressive shoe that will help you progress, definitely a contender along with the Scarpa Instinct VS. you won’t regret spending the cash.
review.name: Great shoes, highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Otaki in Japanese Samurai slang is the oldest single wire sword: extremely sharp and precise also on small targets.  A concept perfectly applicable to climbing: Otaki is a precise, supportive and structured climbing shoe, ideal for climbing in crags, on walls and boulders thanks to features that meet the requirements of today's modern climbers. The new construction method combines the advantages of the all round snug fit of a slipper to the precision and volume regulation of a Velcro closure shoe.  This solution guarantees maximum sensitivity and precision even in torsion: the shoe perfectly follows the movements of the climber eliminating empty volumes and rigid zones. The Innovative S-Heel? allows to maintain perfect torsion stability accentuating performance and adaptability in heel hooks when bouldering.
review.name: Otaki product video

name: Otaki Climbing Shoe

I was looking for an alternative to my hot waders  and these guide pants are perfect for wet wading in the summer.  They dry quickly, have plenty of pockets (two are zippered), and can be thrown into the washer. Worth the money.

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva TX3 Approach Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of the TX3, I been using them for years, they perform, are comfortable and durable. I love this shoes for hiking and approaching my climbs. In my opinion the best of the TX line. I will change nothing except the color, I am so tired of the orange. More color variety will be good.
review.name: Buy it!

review.reviewBody: I have had the TX2, TX3, and TX4 as well as the TX Guide. The 3 is the best overall in my view. More supportive than the 2 and more flexible than the 4. Really like that the approach series doesn't have the upturned toe that the trail runners have. The lacing system on the TX Guide is overkill. Doesn't need that many crosses in the laces and is hard to adjust the fit. The only thing the TX3 needs is a couple of different color options.
review.name: TX3 is the best in my view

review.reviewBody:
Used the 15% coupon and still paid $135 from Backcountry.  Looked at it on Amazon....price dropped down to $68 AFTER I bought it from Backcountry.  Live and learn. 

Otherwise, nice shoes....probably not worth the $135 though.
review.name: Good Shoe....Found It 1/2 Cost At Amazon

review.reviewBody:
I have worn these shoes bushwacking to an approach in the Sandias, and up the Owen - Spalding route on the Grand Teton  through boulder fields with a 50 pound backpack.  I was worried about the ankle and foot support for 14 miles and 14K vertical feet round trip, but they did great and no issues at all.  I was going to switch to climbing shoes at some point on the Grand (5.4), but just stayed in these TX 3's the whole time.
Extremely pleasantly surprised at overall performance.
 I wear a normal shoe size of 10 medium to 10 wide and the size TX 3 size 10 / EU 43 fit great.
review.name: TX 3 review

review.reviewBody:
After I did some scrambles in running shoes, I thought maybe it was best I got some approach shoes. Sooooo gooood. I almost want to climb in them. The compound is amazing. 

I?ve got a wide foot and they fit well and are comfortable. True to size. 

Now I have to upgrade my climbing shoes to something with the same compound.
review.name: So sweet. Super grippy

review.reviewBody:
Shoes only have about 12 miles on them, but something on the inside of the heel cup has folded over leaving a lump in the shoe. Now they are blister makers. Disappointed.

Other than that I really liked them. Grippy rubber and pretty comfortable.
review.name: Think I got a lemon.

review.reviewBody:
I have a 3E wide foot and this shoe fits well out of the box and even better after it stretches a bit. I love it for its comfort and how fantastically grippy it is. Great for terrain with rocks and slabs. It's been up the Grand Teton, and has logged lots of miles in the White Mountains. It's so comfortable I even wore it on non-rocky terrain up Kilimanjaro.

One poster mentioned that they get wet easily. True, but they are super-breathable and dry very fast. As always, there are trade-offs.

La Sportiva is discontinuing this shoe, but Backcountry still carries it. I just bought a spare pair for when my current one gives up the ghost. Maybe I should buy a second spare.
review.name: Love it. Great for wide foot

review.reviewBody: I love this shoe so much, I'm on my fourth pair. It fits snugly on my narrow feet, almost like a climbing shoe. At the same time, it is so comfortable I can hike all day in it without any problem. The mesh upper breaths really well, so my feet never get too hot. The sole is sticky and grabs on slabby rock better than my climbing shoes. This shoe is my default for hiking, backpacking, alpine climbing, and approaching on scree or rugged terrain, and I only switch to my mountaineering boots or climbing shoes when I absolutely have to. On more than one occasion I even rigged up my crampons to fit for a glacier climb and left the mountaineering boots behind.
review.name: love this shoe!

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like these. Tried them as a hiking/ multi-day backpacking shoe. 

First impressions: incredibly well made, comfortable upper, nice lacing system, amazing sole and traction.

Wearing around the house, I started noticing some numbness in the ball of my foot. I think I maybe tied them a little tight, but not so much that the upper was putting pressure on the top of my feet. I wanted to test them out more to see if walking around might allow my feet to settle, so I got out separately for a walk and a 2 hour hike the next. On the walk, the numbness persisted, and they were less breathable on a hot day than I would have expected a mesh upper to be.

On the hike, I really noticed the narrow toe-box putting pressure on my little toe. I don't have abnormally wide feet, so this was a little disappointing, though maybe to be expected in an approach shoe. Anyway, that aren't going to work for me. But they are a really well constructed shoe, which I appreciate. They seem to work well for many others!
review.name: well made but too narrow for my foot;

review.reviewBody: Really a great all around shoe. From walking around all day to backpacking to scrambling on rocks, climbing walls, handling snow this shoe handles it all well. I?ve gotten to the point where unless I need crampons, I?ll wear this shoe.
review.name: Best all around shoe

name: TX3 Approach Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the RockyMounts MonoRail Platform Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MonoRail Platform Hitch Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the RockyMounts MonoRail Platform Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've only had the rack on for a little over a month but it was super easy to build, simple to load and travels very well. It is less obtrusive than my 4 bike rack and allows me to throw my bike on at a moments notice.
review.name: Easy and straight forward

review.reviewBody: After an exhausting search we settled on this Rocky Mounts Monorail unit. Lighter and more compact than others, this unit is a dream to work with. No extra parts; straight forward. Loading our bikes couldn’t be easier and once loaded, they are secured in a rock solid mount that even gives me the confidence to travel off road. The receiver locking mechanism is genius and the tilt-down function is a life saver for when you need to access the rear hatch. If you are in the market for a bike mount, and this meets your specifications, buy in confidence.
review.name: The Best Rack Period.

review.reviewBody: I cannot review this bike rack yet because I can’t use it. The product description states there is an adapter that makes it usable for a 2” hitch. It did not come with that. On line “tech” support was a joke and then they vanished. So now I guess I will just purchase the 2” replacement hitch base from the Rocky Mounts website.
review.name: Marnye

review.reviewBody: Purchased two years ago and have used it probably 20 on very short trips. At the time they only offered the 1.25" with a 2" sleeve that screws into the base. I went to put it on this week and it wiggled itself loose due to so much play in between the 2" sleeve and the hitch. No matter how tight I screw it in, it comes lose in about 20 minutes of driving. I contacted Rockymounts customer service and they admitted that the sleeve is notorious for having too much play and that I should just purchase the replacement 2" base. Really disappointed that I can't trust a $500 dollar rack to haul my bikes.
review.name: Look at another brand

review.reviewBody: Replaced an older Kuat NV 1st gen. This rack is lighter but has solid quality construction. Bike clamps solid with little to no wobble. The tilt lever is way more ergonomic compared to reaching between bikes to pull the Kuat lever. The cable lock is a separate piece vs the integrated Kuat solution but the Kuat locks are terrible and can be raked open in 2 seconds. Factor in the lower cost and the Rockymounts is a clear winner.
review.name: Awesome rack

review.reviewBody: We originally purchased the West Slope and found that it didnt fit our bikes well. We just upgraded to the Mono Rail and it is fantastic!!
review.name: Great economy bike rack!

review.reviewBody: I really like this rack. Assembly was easy took 15-20 minutes at most and is easy to install on your vehicle. I like that the hitch pin screw's in it makes the rack very stable. I'd give it a 5 star if the provided locks were metal. The casing is plastic and seems like it would be super easy to break. They sell metal locks which I purchased on the Rockymounts website. The locks are only $2.00 more each then the plastic locks. I wish they would raise the price $10 and provide the metal locks instead of the cheap plastic ones. If you buy one of these racks which I do recommend plan on buying 2 more metal locks at $20 a piece.
review.name: Great rack and great price

review.reviewBody: I have a Kuat NV 2 and got this for another vehicle and was surprised at how nice it was. If you want to save some money over higher end ones this is a good option. It does not have an integrated lock thought
review.name: Top performer for the price

review.reviewBody: For the price, this rack is extremely well built, and has some great features.  I love the easily accessible tilt handle and the solid way it "clicks" into place.  I added a $10 hitch tightener to help stabilize the up/down movement, and have full confidence in this rack for long trips.  So far I haven't scraped it on anything, and am happy with the high positioning of the bikes. The lock mechanism is a little finicky, but seems as secure as what the other brands offer.  The black finish and appearance of this rack looks great for the price point.  Overall, I'm super pleased and highly recommend.
review.name: Solid!
comment: Does the hitch tightener add more stability ?
Does it have the 1.25 receiver  already ??

review.reviewBody: We have used this rack several times now and are very pleased. The Rocky Mounts Monorail is aesthetically pleasing, easy to build/install, easy to load/unload, and very solid/stable. We have had two 29er mountain bikes on the rack at highway speeds of 80+ and on rough country roads with no issues in either scenario.
review.name: Nice Rack!

name: MonoRail Platform Hitch Rack

description: Buy the Thule Crossover 2 44L Duffel online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Crossover 2 44L Duffel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Crossover 2 44L Duffel online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Well built bag. But know that it is stiff and doesn’t squish into overhead bins like some duffles do. Also, wish they could find a way to make the zippers not clang together so loudly while hoofing it through the airport.
review.name: Nice Bag

review.reviewBody: I received this as a gift from my husband, he purchased this online. I have been using this bag every day for 6 mos and there are no signs of wear.  Very classy looking.  The handles, and strap hardware still look like new. I like the fact that the bag seems molded in structure.  I go from work to the gym with this bag.  I am able to carry gym clothes, street clothes, toiletries, ipad, power cords, etc, with no problem.  An open main compartment allows for easy organization and access. The blue lining is great for visibility of contents.  The front pocket is very useful for smaller items. I can easily carry my shoes and water bottle in the side pockets. Despite the heavy contents of the bag, the bag is comfortable to carry using either shoulder strap or handles.
review.name: Very durable!  Many great features!

review.reviewBody: Bag was everything as advertised. Main compartment is very spacious. Enough room to pack all items for an extended weekend. Side spaces will each hold a pair of shoes. Easily accessible stash pocket for smaller items to reach quickly. Material is stylish and durable. Exactly what is expected of Thule!
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: It is a really smart looking duffle bag and ideal for travelers. Perfect for my 4 day trip. Fits nicely in the overhead bin on the plane. Lots of pockets, easy to carry, easy to pack and unpack. It will be a great travel Duffle bag for any trip. Attaches easily over the pull out handle on my larger suitcase. Seems quite durable.
review.name: Excellent Carry-on Duffle bag

name: Crossover 2 44L Duffel

review.reviewBody: Great fit as it hugs the leg and boot. I was a bit surprised there was no zip at the front (hence 4 stars. ) The Velcro is very sticky atm I just wonder how long that will continue to be the case.
review.name: Great fit as it hugs

review.reviewBody: Love these gaiters, can’t believe this is the first pair I’ve had, perfect for muddy, wet terrain. Wore them on a 7-day walk and they saved my trousers and well as keeping the tops of my boots dry.
review.name: Love these gaiters, can’t believe

review.reviewBody: The fit of these gaiters are perfect, they do what they are supposed to do! As always with Rab, you get what you pay for!
review.name: The fit of these gaiters

review.reviewBody: Good sturdy gaiters - just what I was looking for.
review.name: Good sturdy gaiters - just

review.reviewBody: Good gaiter, the strap underneath the foot is substantial and the overall fit is good. The only problem was it was very difficult to fit the hook on to the boot lace and took some time. The hook is quite narrow and although it means, it will not come off when it’s attached, it can be tricky to put on.
review.name: Good gaiter, the strap underneath

review.reviewBody:
Really pleased with these gaiters, they don’t fall down and keep me dry. Exactly what they are meant to do.
Would definitely recommend them.
review.name: Really pleased with these gaiters,

review.reviewBody: Good gaiter. The Velcro fastening is wide and secure. The clip to attach to the boot lace is easy enough to get on but fiddly to remove (had to take the boot off with the gaiter still attached in the end). Kept the snow out all day but was defeated by a very wet bog I stuck my foot into and then couldn’t get out of immediately. For the price, I think they’re very good gaiters and would buy again.
review.name: Good gaiter. The Velcro fastening

review.reviewBody: I have quite skinny calves and found that the medium size fitted well and stayed up throughout a long walk due to the elastic at the top. These are exactly what I wanted!
review.name: Good fit for skinny legs

name: Trek Gaiter - Women's

review.reviewBody: This belt has a critical flaw: the end that you thread through the buckle begins to fray immediately. I’m talking like split into 4 pieces within days of use. The design is nice looking but the buckle is too tight so the belt just degrades immediately. Backcountry made it very difficult to do a warranty claim so I prob won’t be using this site much in the future.
review.name: Not great and backcountry wasn’t easy

review.reviewBody: This data fits most sizes and said it was 44 inches long. It may be prior to stitching and including the fasteners, but it surely didn't fit a waist size above 36.
review.name: Size listed misleading

review.reviewBody: Just what i wanted and it holds up good with only friction.  Looks good too❗️
review.name: I love my belt

review.reviewBody: Great belt, just wide enough but not too much, will keep your britches up with understated but cool style.
review.name: Great belt

review.reviewBody: A thin, plastic buckle makes the belt feel so cheap. The belt just barely fits my 36 inch waist. I have 2 other Patagonia belts with a metal buckle. Those are quality belts. This belt is a disappointment.
review.name: ok, if your waist is less than 36 inches

review.reviewBody:
The belt seems very well made, and I love it- but if your waist size is over 34, you may want to look at something else.  I am between 34 and 36, and the 2 ends barely touch, let alone connect.

No worries though, my wife or daughter can use it, so I'll still keep it.
review.name: Not for big boys

review.reviewBody: As a belt it does what it is supposed to do; hold your pants up! Sharp looking with the multiple colors and the belt slips through the buckle smoothly. My only gripe is I had to melt and crimp the tip of the belt since it frayed after only two wearings. Other than that the belt is very good. I like it and would purchase another since there is a ?fix? if the belt starts to fray. For sizing perspective I wear a 32 waist jeans/pants and the belt has plenty of length without being too long in my opinion.
review.name: Very good but not perfect

review.reviewBody:
I would not recommend this belt. The belt tip is not well terminated and doesn’t clear through the buckle well, causing it to fray a bit every time you feed it through. I’ve had it for like 2 weeks and it looks like below. 

Bummer. Last belt I had like this was unphased and unfrayed after 4 years, then I lost it.
review.name: Belt Frays
comment: Cut it cleanly, then singe/melt the ends with a lighter, heat gun, or hot knife.

name: Friction Belt - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was pleasantly surprised when I purchased this new sleeping bag - looking for a new down bag, packable, and would keep me warm through the cold Montana nights in Glacier National Park. I found the perfect fit - I have taken it on a few backpacking trips now and look forward to taking it out on more next summer!
review.name: Warm and packable sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I brought this bag on the Camino de Santiago. It gave me plenty of warmth when the temperatures dropped down to 40F without making me feel overheated in warmer temps. I only wish that the zipper extended down further. It was lightweight and easy to compress and carry in my 24L backpack. I highly recommend this bag.
review.name: I brought this bag on

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag to replace an older one I had for 15+ years.  It is so lightweight, but super comfy. Especially love the head area!!
review.name: Beautiful sleeping experience

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sleeping bag, super warm, great loft, and incredibly packable. I have't tested it out below 25 degrees yet but even at 30 I can't zip cause I'm too warm (and I'm usually a cold sleeper!). I switched from a Big Agnes 0 degree womens bag to this one and have been blown away by everything. And I really appreciate that the bag comes with a compression sack!
review.name: Incredible bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my down sleeping bag from sea to summit. The bag is so soft and comfortable. It fit my body perfectly. The material feels pretty durable. I love the colors.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Summit Spark Down women’s sleeping bag
Is incredibly light so great for a backpacking trip.  There just enough insulation to give a bit of padding and comfort.  I am just over 5 ft and it fits great with some room to spare.  I will say that if it is not cool out and you are a warm sleeper then it does get a bit toasty but it is super easy to use the zipper to get some air.  I have not yet tried it in super cold temps but am looking forward to it as our entire family loves to camp.
review.name: Perfect sleeping bag for backpacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sleeping bag! It is so light and easy to pack! I haven’t used it in extreme cold temps but it was enough to keep me toasty warm on a 40 degree night. I would recommend this to anyone!
review.name: Light and easy to travel with!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect sleeping bag! It is also the nicest, softest, lightest, sleeping bag I have ever used. It is seriously so light I can hold it up with the tip of my pinky. This would be a great choice for backpacking because it is so light. It also will keep you very warm on cold nights. I love the color scheme too! All around the perfect bag for me!
review.name: The Perfect Sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Omg this is the lightest sleeping bag that I ever have. It’s even lighter than my down jacket. We tested it at our backyard for my kids home camp day. It’s really warm enough for  50-ish degrees at night. And it is a women size but definitely could fit in a teen. This would be a perfect sleeping bag for our summer camp at upper north!
review.name: Lightweight but warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product to give my honest review, I love how comfy it is and this really easy to take it everywhere, the material it’s really good!
review.name: Good

name: Spark Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pro Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Using these shoes for road and gravel riding. Very comfortable. Easy to fine-tune the adjustment with the BOA system, but a little concerned about the longer-term durability of the BOA cords. Color is a little lighter than indicated on the site. Fit runs slightly large.
review.name: Excellent shoe

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pro Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
So far I really like the shoes after 200 miles, but there are a few changes I'd like to see to make it a great shoe.  I plan on using these for both MTB and Gravel rides and races.
When you put these on, they do feel really good.  Calling them Slippers might be a stretch but, the fit is close to the best out of the 15+ pairs of shoes I have owned in the past 30 years and probably the other 20 pairs I've tried on.  My feet are long and pretty narrow, and my toes splay out.  I have a narrow heal, no bunnions, or anything weird like that, but my foot would be considered low-volume (ie. narrow vertically).  The Expedition has generous toe-box room, good mid-foot space and a nice supportive heal cup.  You can see some puckering on top of toe box due my low foot volume.  Compared to Shimano XC702 (reg) shoes, these are wider/roomier but the heel is just a tad looser.  I owned the original Specialized Recons (laces model) way back and found them too narrow in the front/toe box.  In fact, I believe that was the shoe that gave me Morton's Neuroma in my foot for 3 years:/. Not fun...  After having a Dr look at it and give cortisone injections, I switched to Lakes shoes (for Mtn, CX, and Road), and eventually the painful neuroma disappeared and I have had zero problems since.  I also have owned Shimano road and MTB shoes in the past and didn't seem to have problems with them, but they are narrower than Lakes I feel. 
Dislikes: The Boa's work great and tighten the shoes very well, but the upper strap digs into front of my left ankle for some reason.  I feel the shoes tongue could be a tad longer and have relief cuts in it to help protect ankle a bit more.  Or.....move the Boa down 1/4" so it pulls down more on the top of the foot rather than near the ankle?  I may need to modify (ie. cut) some relief into the strap the Boa is attached to.  It's easy to tighten Boa's too tight to secure shoes only to discover my feet going numb.  During every single ride so far, I had to stop, loosen all Boa's to prevent feet going numb.  This in turn can makes some heel movement felt if Boa's aren't quite tight enough.   Not the most walkable shoe due to stiff carbon soles and Boa feeling too close to ankle for me.
Likes: 
Shoes come with decent insoles.  Stiff carbon sole provides efficient pedaling.  Easy cleat positioning.  Nice grippy lugs.  Toe cap and heel protector look nice.  Shoe breathability seems to be plenty for me.   Shoes look good.  Love the color.  Sizing seems accurate.  I wear US12 and bought 47's.  Pretty lightweight as well.
Neutral:  This shoe doesn't have toe spike capability.  So probably not using this shoe in muddy races.
review.name: Really good, but could be great

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pro Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
So Happy to have gotten this shoe, it by far is my favorite I have ever ridden in. 

This shoe has an amazing fit out of the box and no need to "break in". I love being able to pop the bottom boa to get some extra blood flow with some foot issues I have. It makes my rides longer for sure. 

Overall, so happy to have bought this shoe and will likely stick with it for a long time!
review.name: Best Shoe in the Game!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pro Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Before having these shoes, I’ve used top shoes from Specialized, Sidi, Shimano, Giro, etc. So I’ve seen my fair share of what top of the line shoes should feel like, and so seeing Pearl Izumi make a shoe that competes with a shoe like the Shimano S-Phyres, for a significantly lower price, I was instantly intrigued, and had to find out for myself if these shoes were really as good as Pearl Izumi made them out to be. 

	Starting from the first ride, I was blown away. These are easily the most comfortable shoes that I’ve ever ridden, and they feel great straight out of the box, which I have never experienced before with any other shoe. I also love that the BOA system uses a different material for the straps, and it makes it easier to loosen and tighten the shoes without having to wrestle with a stiff cable. 

	When comparing them to my Shimano S-Phyre shoes, I found that the weight difference was only by a couple grams, and both pairs were equally stiff in the sole, providing a very direct power transfer from my feet to the pedals. So to think that these shoes are in the same realm as Shimano’s top shoes, for a significantly lower price. It may seem like the quality of shoes your getting for the price your paying sounds too good to be true, but it is indeed true, and if you don’t believe me, try a pair for yourself!
review.name: Best Bang for your Buck out there!

name: Expedition Pro Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this primarily for travel. It fits me well and is lightweight. It's supposed to be a blue heather, and close inspection shows that it is, but from a distance it looks more like a black heather. With that said, I like the color. It is just a little bit itchy for me, but I hope that will improve with more washes.
review.name: Nice lightweight long-sleeved T

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this and another item for a beach vacation, just in case there was a cool morning. The color is perfect and it is just the right weight fir a cool morning or evening, or as a base layer for colder days! Worth every oenny!
review.name: Great t-shirt!

review.reviewBody: The yellow Lux color is bright and pretty but what is with the new high neckline on all of this seasons IB shirts? It is uncomfortable and irritating. I had to return. I also think this version of the Sphere runs slightly smaller (shorter and tighter) than the previous version.
review.name: Neck line too high, ouch

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very comfortable but the neck got stretched out after first cleaning.
review.name: Wonderfully soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear this as an everyday top. Great weight for the fall weather. Fitted but not tight and it's a beautiful shade of blue. Can't wait to buy more colors.
review.name: Satisfied buyer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Its so soft and pleasant to wear. I will buy another carol too.
review.name: I will buy more colors of this shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shirt for the desert. It is light but protects you from sun. It is good for layering too.
review.name: Light and soft, perfect for hot days

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Use for backpacking. Lightweight, comfortable, quick drying, not clingy. Definitely showed all dirt and salt marks from sweat, but NO STINK after 4 days and 40 miles on the trail.
review.name: Winner!

review.reviewBody: Other companies figured out the obvious - get rid of nasty plastic tags or make them easy to remove completely. Icebreaker is going the opposite way - make the tag on this shirt as bulky as possible. Make the tag impossible to remove - it is sewn in so that removing it destroys the seam.
review.name: Nasty obnoxious tag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great lightweight shirt and I love that I can wear it casually or for working out / hiking, etc. It's not itchy and super comfortable.
review.name: Not itchy!!

hasVariant.name: Trail Lite Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Trail Lite Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up and great to sleep in.
review.name: The best tent I have ever slept in

author.name: The Best Tents - The North Face

review.reviewBody: We love this tent! Very fast and easy to put up, lightweight for a 3 person tent. I wish it had little corner stash pockets in all 4 corners so if you're skewing head to toe everyone has a pocket, but not a big deal.
review.name: Light, roomy, easy to assemble

review.reviewBody: I can't understand how TNF can continue to sell this tent. While it's nice for dry weather, there is a serious design flaw. The tent collects water in pools on top. I found this to be the case with both the 3 and 4 person models. Will be trying to return both.
review.name: Design Failure

review.reviewBody: Love the spacious design. But water pools at each low spot on the roof, due to near flat pitch design. Seams are also leaking on second season of use.
review.name: Struggles in the rain

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought for camping and backpacking, mostly in northern Minnesota. Took it to a campground and the temps were in the 48-52 F range overnight. We were chilly with very warm sleeping bags and blankets layered on top. The tent itself is easy to set up, good quality. Stood up to a light morning rain. The vestibule design is nice for keeping shoes outside. The tent is very well ventilated, which is likely why we felt the cooler temps. Will be nice for summertime. The fine mesh keeps bugs outside. Overall a great tent!
review.name: Ventilation good for summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for warm weather camping in spots like Hawaii. Lots of ventilation!
review.name: Buy this tent for warm weather climates

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I could not find the size for these tents anywhere online. So if anyone else is looking for the same thing. Here are the dimensions for the Trail Lite 3. H: 112cm W: 155 cm L: 224cm After a summer spent dying in an old winter tunnel tent, i am looking forward to spending this summer in the Trail Lite 3, i have not tried out outside, but i put it up to check it. And so far its the easiest tent i have ever put up. The materials feel like they are high quality and will stand the test of time. The only thing Im hesitant about is that there is no ventilation in the top of the rain cover. But i suppose you could open both of the doors slightly at the top under the lip, and get airflow through without it raining inside. Never thought i would be excited about a tent, but this one is so cool.
review.name: Dimensions

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One of the easiest set ups for a tent I've seen! The vertical walls helps make good use of the space. The short overall height makes it look as if it will hold up to high winds. I havent been able to use it outside yet but I'm hoping it performs as well as the set up. I'll update my rating in the spring!
review.name: Simple set up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have only set up at home so far.... The good: am really pleased with the internal space, and the ease of set up. The not so good: Will probably be switching the pegs for those of our old tent as they are excessively heavy. Volume when packed is a bit big so will look to get a smaller stuff sack to reduce the volume when packed.
review.name: First look looks great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very spacious, well designed, and affordable 3 person tent. Pretty hyped on the construction of the tent, and how basically 90% of the tents surface is just screen when you dont have the rain fly on. The X shape design really creates this cool space when you are laying down in the tent and looking up at the sky. Makes the tent feel very roomy, yet cozy. Lots of space and storage. I use this tent for my wife, 6 month old daughter, dog, and myself. Perfect size for all of us and gear. Quality tent, built with quality materials. Would buy again.
review.name: Pop it up with ease!

name: Trail Lite Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Goal Zero Alta 50 Portable Fridge online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alta 50 Portable Fridge
hasVariant.description: Buy the Goal Zero Alta 50 Portable Fridge online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Short term review: we bought this for our sail boat as a freezer.  Lid comes off if you need an extra two inches to get it in some place.  We set to 0 degrees and it maintains well. Took a while to get down to temp and it helps to keep it full to maintain, ours only varies +3..  So quiet! Wish there was a led to know it is on.  The 50 is tons of room.  We can freeze enough to get 2-3 week extension on our sailing.  Sturdy and the cover is nice.  It really does help also.  Latches are good.  Very little cooling leakage we tested with a thermal scope. Less than our drawer refrigerators.  Flexibility on power was a must for us as our boat was 220ac  and 12 volt dc. Other good units are not as flexible. Power draw seems on par our better than any unit out there with this capability.   Our only concern is longevity as compared to the other units out there that have decades of life.  nothing gives us pause right now, it’s just the one remaining thing I can’t vouch for yet.
review.name: Meets and exceeds all our expectations for now

review.reviewBody: I the Alta 50 about two weeks ago and I’ve tested it using my Yeti 1400 and my Yeti 200x.  The Alta 50 is real energy sipper.  It went from 66F to 36F in 30 minutes.  I ran it with the Yeti 1400 for several days and the Yeti still had plenty of power left.  I plugged my 200x into when it was already chilled down and after 12 hours the 200x still 29% of its power left.  I never could get the Bluetooth goal zero app to display the internal temperature of the Alta.  I was able to use the app to change setting, but internal temperature was always wrong.  This unit will be part of our overlanding system.  Goal Zero just needs to work on that app.
review.name: Great at using little energy

review.reviewBody: Great product! Keeps my beer chilled! Size is also perfect for my truck. Great replacement for ice-coolers. Looks are pretty slick! When not in the truck we put it in the Garage to cool beverages. Also comes handy during power cuts.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I was torn between this one and the 80, but I'm glad I went with the 50 because the 80 it bigger and this is just right size wise for a few days camping off grid. I bought this with the new Yeti 700 too which I was also pleased with. I've compared this with the ARB cooler and one other and I felt the quality was just as good at a lower price point. I was really impressed when it arrived quickly AND found out that some of the hardware powering the cooler is LG.
review.name: Didn't Disappoint

review.reviewBody: Only used a couple times so far but it’s been great paired with the yetti 700. Last weekend the temps were touching 100 degrees and it had no problem keeping up. Had it set at 36. Didn’t run down the yetti near as much as I thought it might. Didn’t even hook up the solar panels the last day and was running the skylight as well after dark. Definitely recommend
review.name: So far it’s been great

review.reviewBody: This cooler is a beautiful design. It's beefy and runs almost completely silent. It sips energy from my Yeti for all day use. I'm impressed.
review.name: Excellent Adventure Cooler

review.reviewBody: I have been shopping for the best one, and I think I have found it.  Great product and would recommend it to anyone.
review.name: Alta 50

review.reviewBody: Only used once so far, but it met expectations. Used about 500wh for 48hrs, set at 36. It is large, deeper than others of a similar volume, and I had to modify the hinges on my (extended cab) truck to get the rear doors to open wide enough to get it in the back. My fault for not paying closer attention to the dimensions, so no fault of the unit.
review.name: Worked well, and efficiently, though a bit large.

review.reviewBody: out of the box you can see and feel the quality and surprisingly enough it didn't come with a super heavy product.  The digital display works great and offers all the pertinent information. Match it with the GOAL Zero app and you can function the fridge from your phone.
review.name: top notch quality

name: Alta 50 Portable Fridge

review.name: Stylish gilet

review.reviewBody: I love this gilet as an extra layer under a coat in the winter and a throw over sweatshirt layer as it gets warmer. It’s a nice length and has two good sized pockets. I could have sized down as it is a slightly oversized cut. #teamsweatybetty
review.name: A great mid layer

review.reviewBody: Delighted by the colour and feel of this gilet. It’s not the warmest so depending on the weather conditions I’ll need to wear it under another coat. I got this gilet in the sale, I would not have paid full price due to the warmth. Fit is quite boxy but a good length. I’m a 10/12 and the small fit me with plenty of room. I could have sized down to xs.
review.name: Love the colour and feel of this gilet!

review.reviewBody: I already have a thicker gilet from sweaty betty and love it and wanted one more to wear with a jacket  for dog walking and on its own for running. It’s fantastic. Warm, light, stylish, good length.
review.name: Love this gilet!

review.reviewBody: I have a couple of SB gilets and frequently wear them to layer up or wear when working out outside.  I went with my usual size but it was too big even to wear over a big sweater/sweatshirt.  It is quite a boxy design and I wasn’t particularly keen on the bottom hem pull-in as it kind of made the gilet look more puffed up.  I returned the item.
review.name: Really nice colour but the sizing big.

review.reviewBody: Amazing feel gilet, good quality material, two ways zip
review.name: Great feel & look gilet

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous colour, great quality and not too thick so ideal for the autumn
review.name: Happy Shopper

review.reviewBody:
I've used it while camping in the 40's as a mid-layer and I'm pretty happy with it. It was a tad thinner than I expected, but that's ok. After a full day outside it did start to smell a small amount. I paid a sale price so my brain says it was a great deal, but if I paid full price it would have been typical quality for the price.

Most US small men's clothing fits like a trash bag on me which is frustrating (x-small is rarely available). I was happy that this fit with a tad bit of room but could easily be layered over without bunching up much. I would have been happy if it were slightly smaller as well. I'm 5'10" ~150 lbs with narrow shoulders.
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: good product, but the quality of the seams is not very good, after a month of use the seams began to deteriorate
review.name: good product

review.reviewBody:
Surprised to find myself wearing this so often as a key layer for my winter activities -  downhill ski, cross country ski classic or skate, hike, snowshoe and social.  

Fit is fine for your fit frame - lean cut and stretchy enough in the shoulders for cold weather skate skiing.  I'm 6'2"  32" waist -  the Large fits well  without being tight or saggy

hood is perfect fit over ski helmet - light and flexible when I'm not willing to mummy up into my heavier jacket shell hood.
review.name: Does it all - would buy again, but gone

review.reviewBody:
The fit is very tight and appeared to be made more for a woman than a guy. 
I wouldn't recommend unless you are slim and even then, size up.
review.name: Runs small and is feminine

review.reviewBody: I have noticed a lot of the stoic stuff that I have liked but didn't know if the quality there. They have had tons of stoic stuff on sale for the holidays and I decided to pick up a few of their things. Let me tell you the quality is excellent. I will buy more of their stuff.
review.name: Hard to beat for the money.

review.reviewBody: The yellow is much darker than it appears in the pictures.  Closer to gold than yellow.
review.name: Color Issues

review.reviewBody:
I bought a large based of the ‘Models’ height and weight description.  I’m 6’,  200lbs and this is tight. Definitely could have gone XL.  
Decent product at the sale price…not full price.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody:
Great jacket material, excellent fit, looks good, everything about it was exactly what I expected with one exception.  I received a jacket with the zipper pull tab on the left side. Since the zipper first appeared in North America the pull tab has been on the right side on jackets and everything else for men.  Left side for women.   The opposite is common in many parts of the world, especially in military surplus.   After a lifetime of the tab being on the right, it is very difficult to change, especially in an emergency, dark, freezing weather, etc. and more so for me who has limited use of sime fingers on the left hand,
Returned the jacket for credit to my account.  Good customer service but I wish I had been able to get one with the zipper tab on the right.
review.name: Zipper Pull

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoes right out of the box. The soles are very grippy. Great for hiking and they look good too. I’d call them three-season - because of the mesh, they might not be good for really cold weather.
review.name: Fun hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair to take advantage of sale.  I’ve had the first pair a year and wear them all the time.  They haven’t gotten worn out yet!  Best low pair of shoes for most hiking.  I use a different astral for water sports but certainly can walk through streams.
review.name: Golden hiking shoes-comfortable day one

review.reviewBody: Second pair.  First pair still with me but a little ragged now.  Comfort is my game.  Love them.  Thank you for still making them.  So often you find a go-to shoe and then they disappear. I may buy another.
review.name: Sturdy  comfort!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and absolutely superb grip. Good arch support and traction on wet surfaces.
review.name: Great hiking low-top with grip!

review.reviewBody:
Bought the TR1 Loop for a day  hike in the Aravaipa Canyon wilderness. I was looking for non waterproof hiking shoes , good in wet, sandy and rocky conditions. Roughly 30% of the hike was spent walking in the creek. Most of the time, water was just over the ankle, rarely up to half the calf. The rest of the hike was over sandy, sometimes rocky terrain. 
Thanks to the TR1 Loop , I felt confident even on slippery surface, compared to my hiking companion, I never had to take off my shoes to remove the sand. The sole was thick enough not to feel the rocks. The water left the shoes very easily. 
One thing to know, I used the TR1 for a day hike at the end of November. It took quite a while for the shoes to dry. If we had stayed in the canyon for the night with cold temperatures, I am not sure the shoes would have been dry the next day. Not really an issue since they will get wet again but still never a good feeling to put on wet shoes in the morning when it's cold, you just need a thick pair of wool socks.
For the sizing, I am a women 7.5, usually for hiking shoes, I always bought a half size to a size bigger. For these shoes, I just bought my regular size and was able to put thick socks. I was afraid to "loose" my shoes and for me it was the right choice.
review.name: Perfect for a dayhike on wet, sandy and rocky soil

review.reviewBody:
I've worn the Loops for thousands of miles of trail running, hiking, and backpacking at this point and they continue to be my go-to choice. 

Much of the backpacking I do is off-trail through rugged environments, which tends to wear down shoes more quickly, but the Loops have been incredibly durable. 

They're also very grippy, which makes me feel more secure on slickrock, scree, talus, and when hopping through boulder fields. They're well-draining and quick drying, which is essential for foot health when you're walking through creeks and rivers several times per day. 

In addition to all that, they're so comfortable that I can wear them bare foot without experiencing any rubbing or pressure points. The wide toe box allows my foot to keep it's natural shape so that I can wear these shoes from dawn to dusk and my feet stay happy. 10/10 would recommend these!
review.name: My favorite trail running and backpacking shoe!

review.reviewBody: First, the pros: these shoes are sooo comfortable and super grippy! I have used them for fieldwork, wet wading in streams, and as approach shoes for climbing. Cons: super smelly after only a couple of months and the toe cap is already separating! I bought these after Merrell discontinued their Hydrotrekker shoe (which never ever smelled despite months of using them to wade in rivers). All that said, I am really hard on stuff and mainly disappointed because these were advertised as having special anti-odor tech.
review.name: Good grip but super stinky!!

review.reviewBody: These are amazing! I brought these on a spring trip to Sedona and I wore them the entire trip! From the airport, to the 50 + miles of hiking. These were great on the ice/ snow patches as well as totally trustworthy grip on the red rocks  ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review.name: From snow to red rocks

review.reviewBody: Wore the TR1 Loop on their first river trip and loved them. They are so comfortable that the first thing I did after getting to camp was NOT take off my shoes! They dried quickly and were great for a side hike. Quality shoe from Astral that I might just wear on more than river trips.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is a great shoe except for the fact that you cannot get 1/2 sizes.  I am a true 6.5.  I ordered a 6 and it felt just a little short at the toe.  Not too bad, but I went ahead and ordered a 7 to see if it would fit better.  There was too much room in the toe box so I was afraid of slippage on my heel.  I really like the way wide toe box on these shoes so I was really torn on what to do being I couldnt get a 6.5. I finally tried the 7 with winter socks and that was better.  I decided to get the 7 for winter walking.  Im still upset about not being able to get my size.  Ive never been confronted with not being able to get a 1/2 size.  Who does that anyway?  Not good.I would recommend this shoe if I could have gotten my size.
review.name: Ms

review.reviewBody:
Really good jacket. Very Flattering and Excellent quality.
Fits true to size. Extremely comfortable.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: I always love Smartwool. They feel great and they fit really good. It’s warm without the bulk.
review.name: Thin and warm

review.reviewBody: Purchased my third SmartWool, SmartLoft jacket.  How disappointing to find that this newer version is nearly two inches shorter.  In addition, the sleeves and the back are some weird, unnatural fabric that appears to be "flocked" with wool on the interior side of the fabric.  This weird fabric is not nearly as flexible as wool and thus the entire jacket is not very comfortable for sports.  And isn't that the purpose of this jacket?  The length of the jacket is not really adequate if you're over say 5'4".  It will ride up when active or sitting down and will expose the wearer to cold.  This WAS my favorite jacket!  Please SmartWool, rethink.  I'd stock up on multiple colors annually...
review.name: Shame These USED To Be Fantastic

name: Smartloft Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
The Abrazo Fleece Half-Zip Jacket quickly became a staple in my wardrobe. The material is incredibly soft and keeps me warm without feeling bulky. I love the vibrant color options—it adds a pop of personality to any outfit. The half-zip design makes it easy to layer, and the fit is flattering yet practical, allowing for full mobility.

If you're looking for a cozy and stylish fleece that you can take anywhere, I highly recommend this jacket!

review.reviewBody: The North Face Men's Short-Sleeve Half Dome Tee is a comfortable and stylish option for casual wear. The material is soft against the skin, and it maintains its shape well even after multiple washes. The iconic North Face logo adds a touch of brand appeal without being too flashy. Perfect for both outdoor activities and lounging, this tee offers a great fit and black is my color. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the brand or just looking for a reliable t-shirt, this one is a solid choice.
review.name: North Face Casual shirts are the best quality and fit.

review.reviewBody: Runs small and shrinks. Add to the half dome rotation.
review.name: Shirt! Summit gold half dome

review.reviewBody: I've worn XL t-shirts the last 15 years by various brands, even a half a dozen 100% cotton TNF shirts which are all XL. I Recently purchased several more 100% cotton TNF t-shirts (they hold up in the mountains), Some had zero shrinkage in cold wash, others I had to give to my son. Some Beta, these half dome on the front logos shrink the most, the "Box" graphic on the back versions, almost none.
review.name: Too much shrinkage

review.reviewBody: I always get these t-shirts they last forever and always true to size, simply the best
review.name: Tnf the best
