hasVariant.name: Split Roller 85L Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Split Roller 85L Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Split Roller 85L Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Split Roller 85L Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th Dakine split roller bag and no my friends and family all have one. It’s the best. Truly!
review.name: Wouldn’t travel with anything else!

review.reviewBody: I do a lot of traveling for work as an environmental scientist and this bag is awesome. The boots compartment is perfect for my steel toes, hard hat, and other PPE because it’s sealed off from everything else. Plenty of room for a week’s worth of field clothes and after-work slouch clothes. And the 85-L is just the right size for packing a full bag and not exceeding the standard 50-lb weight limit for most commercial airlines. Plus it’s beautiful and has all the straps in all the right places for lifting and moving. Just bought a second for my partner!
review.name: Awesome Bag!

review.reviewBody: We a big like this in a different color and we love it. It arrived super fast, just in time for my son to travel with for baseball. When you find this big on sale from back country, buy it. Great deal, amazing bag and awesome service!!!!
review.name: Fast Delivery

review.reviewBody:
Very happy with performance.  Used for two week Europe trip, took trains, bus and ferry from Amsterdam to Milan and six different hotels. Lots of unpacking and repacking and walking to and from train stations including cobble stone streets. Handle adjusts to 2 lengths. Multiple grab points on bag and the two compression straps let you reduce bag size and are attached to bottom of bag so not just depending on the zipper. Multiple compartments combined with packing cubes made organizing easy.  Hard shell bottom made bag easy to pack and no worries about it sagging to the pavement.  Very happy with my purchase.  Note, as bag opens up from the middle and has compartments accessed from the inside it can’t be used as a single compartment bag for very large items.  For me bag size was just right, not too big not too small.
I plan to use the bag for hunting trips up north in Michigan and think it will also work well for that (though I’ll still need an extra bag for rubber boots, waders and hunting boots).
review.name: Good capacity, easy to roll, many handle

review.reviewBody: It accommodates all my needs with ease. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Impressive

review.reviewBody: I had super high hopes for this bag. The interior features are great but the lack of overall balance and structure of this bag makes it impractical and annoying. The bag can't stand up straight no matter how you pack it which makes it hard to operate if you have to push another bag or you are travelling with a family.
review.name: Nice Inside / Impractical Outside

review.reviewBody: I love dakine luggage so far.  This bag fits a ton of stuff  and has lots of compartments. Though, for someone looking for one giant compartment, this is not it. One side (bottom) is one open compartment, but the opening side of the bag is split into two compartments.
review.name: Fits a ton of stuff, nice features

name: Split Roller 85L Gear Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this on a whim and am so glad I did! It's super comfortable and breezy feeling in the heat. My sister and I were backpacking in a mosquito-heavy area, so I threw this on, cinched up the bottom and the hood, and didn't get a single bite! In tops, I usually wear a women's M, or occasionally L. Based on other reviews, I went with the L and it's the perfect size.
review.name: Saved me from the mosquitos!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color block, lightweight jacket. nice material
review.name: Light, Colorful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I could wear this every day!  Extremely light but adds a nice layer of protection from wind and/or chill.
review.name: So good I bought another!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and folds up easily. Works as a nice layer
review.name: Lightweight coverage

review.reviewBody: This jacket was fantastic. Super lightweight, great colors. It was a gift for my mom for hiking in Costa Rica. It was a big hit
review.name: She loved it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Made my wife happy. Nice packable lightweight jacket. Fun color blocks.
review.name: Lightweight jacket. Looks great on her.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really impressed with this lightweight pullover so far. Medium fit exactly how I prefer (loose but not oversized) for my measurements (36"-29"-39"). I love the deep front zip which provides for a bit more airflow when moving. Sleeves are long enough on me to pull over my hands for sun protection, but the elastic is tight enough to keep them up at the wrists as well. The hood is generous and stays put over a baseball hat. The looser fit provides better mosquito protection than tighter UPF shirt options. Planning to take this shirt on lots of work and personal adventures.
review.name: lightweight sun protection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First time order from marmot,took little big long time to receive the product,super happy about it,my normal size is S ,bought M for extra comfort,fits perfectly....will be great to wear during summer time!!!
review.name: Super light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just received this today and tried on. I ordered Medium size but I think I can size up too large.  It looks nice and ultra light weight.  You don’t feel wearing anything when you wear it.  I like that you can fold it and pack it.
review.name: Super light weight

name: Campana Anorak - Women's

review.reviewBody: It stores nicely and is light. Seems strong but I have only used it in practice scenarios thankfully.
review.name: Thankfully I've never had to use this for rescue

review.reviewBody: Easy to assemble with a quick throw and pull, very stable once locked up. overall a great probe.
review.name: Simple

review.reviewBody: Simple, easy to use, glad I got the slightly longer one - makes me feel good knowing that the extra reach is there for a very small size-hit. Would recommend.
review.name: Great probe

review.reviewBody: Haven’t had to use this in an actual rescue scenario (thankfully), only used it during avy training but it is light and durable. The locking mechanism was recommended to me by an avy professional because some of the other mechanisms freeze when they get caked with snow or ice.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Fortunately will never have to use this probe in real time but it deploys easily and breaks down quickly. Only drawback I see so far is the handle itself to deploy the probe, unlike the bca that has a more sturdy handle. But that is nitpicking.

Effective, and gets the job done. Locking out the probe is very intuitive and easy with gloves on. However, the probe is not super stiff. I feel that although it did seem to bend more than the carbon version, that during the practice burials it still performed well and didn't deflect too much that it would lead the rescuer to the wrong spot to dig.
review.name: Good probe for the price point

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy deploy, suitable for areas with shallow or moderate depth snowpack.

What else can I say? I have an Arva 280 probe that I love, but this thing is so much lighter and skinnier. I am a little worried that it uses a nylon rope instead of wire...but I also feel like that it would be super easy to replace if it does break, so I guess I'm not that worried!
review.name: So light!

review.reviewBody: Functional probe with poor durability. The plastic ferrules which connect the probe segments easily break in the cold, and cannot be repaired or replaced. If you intend to frequently use this probe (as you should to practice), consider other manufacturers with more durable designs. I did not have issues with the cord (as opposed to metal) connector, but have longevity concerns for this piece of the design as well.
review.name: Poor durability due to plastic ferrules in the cold

review.reviewBody: Works well in practice and seems to be very well made
review.name: Super nice and well built deployment is nice and smooth

name: Probe 280 Speed Lock

review.reviewBody: Really liking this little lantern/flashlight. Excellent light output in a small package. Cool little touch by adding the carabiner for easy hanging. Charge lasts for a long time.
review.name: Cool little lantern

review.reviewBody: Recharged my phone half way which was just what I was hoping for; a quick emergency charge.
review.name: Charges

review.reviewBody: Hello? I bought the Goal Zero and used it outside 3 times. The battery performance is fine for overnight camping. I tried charging my iPhone 14 and it was able to charge about 30%. I think it can only be used for emergency charging. Overall, I am satisfied.
review.name: Great Feature

review.reviewBody: somethimes its the small things in life that really make a differnce.This Light is one of thm
review.name: Small but powerful

review.reviewBody: I bought 20 of these light weight yet powerful mini lanterns for my kids and grandkid in light of the troubled times in America.  Great and simple way to prepare for trouble.
review.name: Great buy and a great product!

review.reviewBody: The lantern is amazingly bright!  I like having a choice of using it as a flashlight or lantern. The battery lasts a long time.
review.name: Bright, powerful

review.reviewBody: Bought it for any Florida pending hurricanes   Love this light. Bright and perfect for any needs.
review.name: Great little light

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these at a local store while on a trip. I charges it up and without using it in 2 days it was dead. I thought maybe I had somehow had it turned on a low setting or something. After I got home I charged it again and made sure it was off. It went from full charge to dead in 2 days without being used. Flashlight is useless if it won't hold a charge for 2 days.
review.name: Does not hold charge

review.reviewBody: I bought several Lighthouse Micros and I use them every time I backpack or camp. They are excellent lights for outdoor recreation. They hold a charge forever! I have one in my fishing pack for an overnight survival situation. The light is more of a natural light and these micros are perfect to hang in a tent.
review.name: Lighthouse micro

review.reviewBody: For when the lights go out, often, I have one in every room. Am I over doing it? Wait, until the lights go out. PS: I admit it, I am a Goal Zero Junky.
review.name: For what it is, it's great.

name: Lighthouse Micro Charge

review.reviewBody: The z poles are light weight and compact. They are easy to pack when not in use and parts are available when needed.
review.name: Z poles

review.reviewBody: I was so happy I could find replacement Z-Pole Trekking tips for my Black Diamond Trekking Poles. They've been with me for several years. Now I'm hiking the NH 4,000 footers with them. Up to 31 with 17 to go to finish. Hopefully next summer 2025! I'll be 71. Photos are from hiking Mount Moriah in 2023 celebrating Halloween at the Top! Converted my poles into a Witch's Broom!
review.name: Happy to Refurbish vs. Trash

review.reviewBody: Bought a new set of z-poles which I like except the basket doesn’t have a slot to hold the collapsed pole together. I can only use a Velcro strap to do this. So I bought these tips which have the aforementioned locking slot to replace mine but can’t get the tips off despite multiple attempts with submersion in boiling water & pliers. Just wish the poles came with it in the first place!!
review.name: Can’t get the ones off which I didn’t like anyway

review.reviewBody:
Bought these hoping to hack the fact that the snowbaskets I need are out of stock (the ones for Distance Carbon Z poles)-- thinking I could just update the tips and then put on the Alpine Z-Pole baskets. Nope. 
At any rate, the instructions were good and in three minutes I had the new tips on. Pretty sure my Distance Carbon Z poles won't last another 8+ years but at least they'll die with renewed tips :)
review.name: Good quality, easy to install

review.reviewBody: Instead of having to throw these away, I was able to replace the warn tips. Thanks for selling parts for alder gear to extend its lifespan!
review.name: Great replacement

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and make your poles look brand new! So glad these are replaceable!
review.name: Easy to install

review.reviewBody: As I aged the hiking tip for the New England Mountains needed to be changed for Florida street balance - the rubber tips are perfect - same poles more opportunities to enjoy them. to enjoy
review.name: New places - continued enjoyment

review.reviewBody: very easy to work just follow simple instruction, better than I expected.
review.name: S. Lin

review.reviewBody: No tenia idea que era tan facil volver a tener como nuevos mis bastones, super facil agua caliente y listo
review.name: Mis bastones nuevos nuevamente

review.reviewBody: good instructions for taking off old tips. New tips went on easily. quality product.
review.name: quality replacement tips for Z-poles

name: Z-Pole Trekking Tips

review.itemreviewed: Facet Sierra Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased it for my wife fits her perfectly and she loves it
review.name: Happy wife happy life

review.itemreviewed: Facet Sierra Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots in January and they are no longer waterproof. I work part time as a park ranger so I wear these 8 hours a day in all sorts of weather. Water is not seeping in at the top of the toe bed. The seams the run along the middle of the foot are also splitting and water is leaking in there too. That is just a poor design choice in my opinion. I'd be sure to keep your receipts, these will not last if worn consistently.
review.name: Not Waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Facet Sierra Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots mid January and there is now water seeping through the folds made by your toes at the front of the shoe. I work as a part time park ranger so I wear these 3+ day a week, 8 hours a day in every sort of weather, so they may be just better for casual use. I was dumb and got rid of receipts about a week after purchase because I was so confident then that they would remain waterproof.
review.name: No longer waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Facet Sierra Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these tonight could not leave the store without them they look like a boot but are a shoe I love the pattern in the sole I wear a ten but in boots usually an 11 with these true to die I have wide feet they are so comfortable and light waterproof not as warm as my other boots w omni- tech but great for wet rainy cold Canada days note to self not a boot but looks like one is a shoe ankle height
review.name: If you have big feet these make your feet look small

name: Facet Sierra Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought two new Pinarello cycles and my wife wanted more of a road tire on her cycle, opposed to the racing tires that came with it. I ordered the folded Rubino Pro tires for the light tread pattern. We find the light tread pattern on the edges offers a more secure grip on the mixed surfaces of our routes. Interestingly, the .030 inch step on the mold-line is the deepest feature on the tire. The fit around the rim was firm and we like it.
review.name: Good feel on the road.

review.reviewBody: Not even one star. Poorly designed and manufactured. The middle part of the tread is not bonded to the cords underneath and is so thin it tears on every ride. A small puncture caused the tread to bubble up all around the tire. Less than 500 miles and both tires were repaired multiple times and now useless.
review.name: Clincher masquerading as a Tubeless

review.reviewBody: This tire was a replacement for one that punctured a couple.of weeks ago. That one got a small hole in the tread area that the latex sealant (Stans) didn't seal. Riding this one I ran over something and then the noise or air and fluid escaping. This time a small hash in the sidewall that again the sealant would not seal. Both occasions needed a tube to get home. I guess if you ride pristine roads they are fine but for the debris potholed things we call roads here in San Diego tougher tires with tubes are probably needed.
review.name: Not as Durable as I Hoped

review.reviewBody: for some reason the 30mm Rubinos are MUCH wider than the 30mm Corsas, and don't fit on my bike (even though I think I could fit a 32 Corsa). Vittoria's quality control also seems to have gone way down recently and my two tires seem to be significantly different radii. One mounts easily and the other one is incredibly hard to go get on the rim.
review.name: bad

review.reviewBody: Just mounted the new 700x30 Rubinos on my Jamis adventure bike. When returning from a 30 mile spin I noticed that both tires have an issue with the molding process quality. The issue is apparently the two half's of the tire mold did not align accurately at the center line of the tire and were off set approximately 0.5 ~ 1.0 millimeters. This means that one side of the tire is higher or lower at 180 degree intervals, making the tire exhibit eccentric motion (wobbly) at higher speeds. I'll be contacting Competitive Cyclist to see is there is a manufacture's warren-tee for defects. There are good tires over-all and I will continue utilize Rubinos on my bikes provided Vittoria gets their manufacturing quality corrected.
review.name: Poor Tire Molding Quality Control

review.reviewBody:
These tires were easy to mount and set the bead using my air compressor. I inflated my tire and rode my bike around the block. The next morning when it was time to walk out the door for a ride, the tire was completely flat. I had 2+ oz of sealant in my tire.

I pumped it up, filled up my sink with water, and immersed my wheel/tire in the water, only to see tiny air bubbles coming up from the sidewalls - all around the tire. Pulled the tire out of the water, and you could feel air coming out from the sidewalls. I don't know how this could happen apart from it being a manufacturing defect.

This is not my first time mounting tubeless tires, and I'm returning these ASAP.
review.name: Defective Tire

review.reviewBody: great! out lasted the Specialize turbos i previously had on by about 300 miles.
review.name: Great Road Tires

review.reviewBody:
Was looking forward to trying these on my recently purchased Mercury G1's which are hookless bead. Tire sidewall says not for hookless!:(   
Ordered SCHWALBE PRO ONE TLE to replace after confirming with Schwalbe USA that fitment is okay for hookless bead.
review.name: Not for Hookless Wheels

review.reviewBody: Been running tubeless for 4 years, on Giant SLR rims with 17mm internal width.  I like these Vittorias better than the Giant Gavias that came with the bike, and better than the Hutchinson Sector 28s I mounted after I wore out the Giants.  Why?  1:  mounted easily without needing levers.  2:  Sealed quickly with a little boost from the compressor.  3:  Immediately held pressure overnight.  4:  Riding them feels fast and smooth.  One caution:  these tires run narrower than the labeled size.  25mm measured just under 23, so I returned them and ordered 28s, which measure about 27.  Only 150 miles so far, so I can't speak to durability.  I have the same question as Giorgio regarding pressure.  I find they work well at 65 - 70.  Can't seem to get an answer to why the manufacturers all  specify an unrealistically high minimum pressure.
review.name: My favorite So Far
comment:
Hey Michael,

I played around a lot with pressures and must say that, being 200lb, I rode this set about 2500miles, from as little as 50F/60R to as much as 70F/80R, and anything in between.
Never at low pressures have I ever experienced any issues, apart from loss of speed.
I now, like you, typically ride 62F/70R.

Having received 10 different opinions from 6 different people, I believe that the high recommended pressure figures are CYA from the manufacturer, no more no less.

Happy riding!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this product because I like the RTDS standard Patagonia uses for its down jackets, going extra steps to ensure the welfare of the geese. 
Unfortunately, the jacket itself is too tight at the hips to be usable. The problem is not with my body type, jackets from other outdoor brands fit just fine. Maybe Patagonia is sizing their womens' clothes for a specific ethnicity, where the women perhaps have very, very, very narrow hips.  But women of *most* ethnicities do not have this body type. 
Alongwith the sustainability focus, I wish Patagonia could add inclusivity to its goals.
review.name: Ill fitting, what a pity

review.reviewBody: This vest is perfect on days too cool for even a long-sleeved t-shirt, but not cold enough for a jacket.
review.name: Fits the bill!

review.reviewBody: I liked the off white (or "white wool") color and style of this Patagonia vest, but was really disappointed in the sizing. I typically wear a size small (5'2", 120 lbs) and could barely close this vest. So I exchanged it and ordered a medium, which was cut very low under the arms and was much too long. Not normal Patagonia sizing.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I bought the vest in cream color. Great quality and looks cute! Was a bit snug at the bottom when I first put it on, but now it fits comfortably. I do think the design is more for people 5'4"+ because of the long torso (I'm 5'2"). Overall I'm very happy with it!
review.name: Great quality but a bit long

review.reviewBody: Well made, warm, and comfortable. A great vest. One star off because the advertised white color is actually off-white.
review.name: Very high quality

review.reviewBody: Warm and nice fit. The elastic around the cuffs and hem was an excellent addition because most other fleece jackets are loose in those areas and tend to stretch out. Also the wind flap inside the zipper is unnecessary and annoyingly bulky. Other than that it's very nice. It's definitely best used as a more casual piece due to its bulk.

review.reviewBody: When I ware these shoes, I sound like a horse on sidewalks! Only good for rugged trails. Not for everyday use.
review.name: No; except for hiking rugged trails.

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent protection for a 78 yr old runner with arthritis in his feet. The firm platform with good gripping action is great for me.
review.name: I am buying this shoe for the second time

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work long hours on my feet most the day and walk at least 6-8 miles a day. Was looking for a shoe with comfort and grip. The foam on these are not very giving and don't provide much cushion making it uncomfortable after long hours on my feet. They do have good grip and the gtx works great from keeping my feet dry in the rain. If you're looking for a shoe to wear for long hours on your feet I would not recommend this model but it would make for a good hiking/trail running shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable, I have wide foot and the half a point more fit perfect, thanks for so good hiking and walk shoes:
review.name: Love this shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great looking shoe - plenty of cushion which is why I wear hokas. They fit a little small so I bought a size up. Spikes are noisy on pavement and hard floors. The Vibram sole should last better as I put some serious miles on these.
review.name: Great shoe for Rucking

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really great feel to these shoes, running on cross country trails in winter AK. Gortex and seams keep feet very dry. Absolutely great traction. Much more comfortable than I expected for gortex and spikes.
review.name: Comfort and control on the ice

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these Speedgoats because HOKA doesn't make a waterproof Stinson 7. I wanted to capture the magic the Gaviota 5's made in my life when out on the golf course in me middle of winter (a mid-state California winter but still cold and wet). The Stinson 7 looks ro be the trail version of the Gaviota 5 but not waterproof. So I bought the Speedgoat with spikes just for the gtx lining. Low expectations but I was amazed. Even though they sound like studded snow tires on dry pavement they grip the ground as I track my golf ball hither and yon. The laces release from a "heel lock lacing" easier than the Gaviotas. I don't know if the spikes add anything to the Speedgoat's grip on wer grass and dirt, but they make my feet feel great after a round.
review.name: Another HOKA game changer

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Should offer the spikes in the GTX mid model. Ran the trail w/a trace of snow and ankles and feet got wet.
review.name: SG4 GTX w/Spikes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for midwestern winter. I haven't used 'em yet.
review.name: First time with Spikes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love hookers, and decided to look into whether they had golf shoes. I was shocked that they did, and ordered them. When they arrived, it was just in time for my member guest golf tournament. When the pro heard the metal clicks walking across pavement, there was concerned about how almost no courses allow old metal spikes. These are constructed in a way that does not harm greens or grass.
review.name: Best golf shoes in over 50 years. Courses allow them

name: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes.  They were Instantly comfortable and give great support.  I have trouble with an arthritic large toe joint and have no issues with it in these Moab Adventure 3’s.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable.  The footbed is comfortable and all around the foot is soft and padded. The shoe fits me true to size. I have had them for about a month and wear them regularly.
review.name: I would recommend.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
why there is no ZERO star?
slippery on wet surface. After 5 uses, inner fabric is worn out blistering my skin.
I regret being a Merrell client for years after experiencing the mediocar customer service and the deteriorated  product quality
review.name: Done with Merrell

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I walk 3 miles everyday. Have had so many blisters and problems with my feet. Merrell are the only shoe that fit right out of the box, no 'breaking-in' needed.
review.name: Can't live without them.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice shoe but the top of tongue is a massive pillow sticking out of shoe tugging on your hiking pants.  Merrell makes good looking shoes but always messes up the basics; thus, I always return them. This time I kept them, but I had to cut the tongue way down and re-sew them. I wish the original tongue was low profile, uncushioned, and flat, not an over-stuffed, high reaching tongue.  Merrell, do you even wear the shoes you make?
review.name: Tongue is a massive pillow you could sleep on

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my husband who loves them!  They required no break-in time, he says they are very comfortable, keep his feet completely dry, and he likes how they look. We do a lot of hiking/walking with our dog. It's often early morning when the grass is still wet.  These wonderful shoes do the trick!!
review.name: "A Great Find"

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Counter lining lacks finger hook to assist donning shoe.   Either Upper or tongue is way too narrow, as it is impossible to obtain full closure of the areas, permitting debris and liquid to enter.  Laces are insufficient in length to insure secure lock of my foot in the shoe.   Break-in was longer than anticipated, but this is not necessarily indicative of defective product as were my earlier three comments.  I have been wearing US size 9 Merrell products for the past 29 years.   Frankly it appears your firm has elected to sacrifice quality in production in favor of increased line items.
review.name: MOAB Adventure 3. FAIL

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Moab Adventure 3 waterproof shoes have been fantastic for my job, which often involves hiking through wet areas. They withstand the demands of my work admirably and typically last an entire season before I decide to replace them. They're easy to clean when they get dirty and dry quickly, ensuring they're ready for the next workday.
review.name: Great Outdoor Work Shoe
comment: Thank you for your glowing review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Walked all day in the rain and mud, feet stayed dry
review.name: Great shoes!
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Adventure 3 WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent shoe that transitions from work to leisure
review.name: Great everyday shoe

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like the look of the table, and it is functionally great. Durability is tbd. It scratches easily, and the first time I used it I put one of my peels on the surface, which then caused the table top to have a brown discoloration in the round shape of the peel.
With the slightest amount of wind my peels were falling off of the peel holders and hitting the ground. I do wish those were a little longer or had some sort of lip to hold the peels in place during a slight breeze.
Overall though it is a great little portable table for my Koda 16.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had no problems with it. it holds air for days. the worst condition i have used it in was wet ground and high humidity with temperatures just below freezing and i was comfortable but it was cool at times so iam looking forward to trying to find its range. I did place an ensolite pad beneath it for protection but perhaps i would have been more comfortable with the ensolite on top. it packs well without adding alot of weight and i like that it has a little cushion to it so even if it fails and air leaks i will still have some protection beneath me.
review.name: I have had no problems

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how lightweight and compact this is for an all season mat. Fits great along with my sleeping bag in the bottom compartment of my bag. Easy to inflate with the bag and keeps you warm and away from the ground. Worth the money and definitely recommend.
review.name: Love how lightweight and compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got back from a third season high country hunt in CO. Spiked out in a hot tent with the new pad. It was warm comfortable and sure seems tough. I would recommend this pad to friends.
review.name: Just got back from a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very satisfied. Kept me warm car camping in 39 degree weather.
review.name: Very satisfied. Kept me warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product meet and exceeded my expectations! After my first one was destroyed in a storm on a motorcycle trip to the badlands back in August. I knew I needed to replace before my backpacking trip near Aspen Co. After waiting too long to order a new one I decided to take my product right to your wear house in Boulder. Left the next morning and slept in a foot of snow above 11,oooft and could have not gotten a better nights sleep after a nine miles out. This product had no problem keeping air throughout the night and not once felt the cold ground underneath me. Ill be honest and did not have all the right gear for the conditions but I am would not have made it through the night without the model Ether Light XT Extreme Air Sleeping Pad!! Packing and unpacking was no issues even in below zero degree temps. I did not get a chance to use the pillow lock system but wish I had set it up because that was the only issue was my pillow moving. Totally my fault not the product and I look forward to installing the pillow lock system before the next use!!
review.name: Ether Light XT Extreme Insulated Air Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this for 2nd rifle elk season in Colorado single digit temps, pad was good to go. Pretty noisy though. This does not fit in a big Agnes sleeping bag sleeve, expect to sleep on top of it like a normal sleeping bag.
review.name: Great gear

name: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat

review.reviewBody: The Lola insulated pant is stylish and keeps my girls warm. We upgraded from a cheap brand to 686 because these are true snow pants. They shed water well and keep my girls warm throughout the day.
review.name: Dry

review.reviewBody: The color is really nice but they were a little too big over all.
review.name: The color is really nice

review.reviewBody: Bought these pants for my daughter, not knowing the first time she would wear them would be in brutally cold conditions, skiing Whitefish in MT. Overnight low temps at the base were -23, and that's real, not real-feel. She layered a couple of thin layers of leggings underneath and never complained about her legs being cold (I asked because I thought she hadn't layered enough).  I can't speak to their moisture resistance, because we never saw a snowflake melt on that trip.
review.name: Near-Arctic Tested

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants! They are super comfortable & look great.
review.name: Favorite new pants

review.reviewBody: I purchased an earlier version of the Breeze Cropped Pant and it did not have the extended waist band with the ties on the outside. The ties "disrupt" the line. I prefer the ties on the inside. If you can return these pant to that design that would be great. The zip back pockets should be mandatory on of these pant. I do not feel as if I might lose something from the back pocket.
review.name: Changes

review.reviewBody: Live these in black. Can dress them up with shoes or candles and a too and swwleater for going out.
review.name: My new go to pants

review.reviewBody: I am so glad I found these pants. Have 3 pair now! Incredibly comfortable, excellent fit, relaxed but classy looking.
review.name: My new go to pants

review.reviewBody: I wanted these to work. They're close to perfection, but they were too big around the waist for me. The sizing/proportions seemed off. But the color and material are perfect. Hopefully they'll fit other people better.
review.name: Comfy pants

review.reviewBody: These are super comfy and feel like they will last and not easily rip like other outdoorsy light weight pants. I am a bit short so they are more like ankle pants than crops though. Also since I am short the become more extra high rise at the waist.
review.name: Best pants!

review.reviewBody: I was reluctant to buy these. Wasn't sure I would like the color. They are beautiful very soft and subdued more neutral color. I love the bamboo material, soft as butter. Size is pretty true. I would say run slightly on the smaller side so if in question or between sizes, Size up! Fit lovely so glad I purchased them. Great deal on clearance! Can't go wrong with these
review.name: Most beautiful color

review.reviewBody: I now have three pairs of the breeze cropped pants. I like them for multiple reasons:-soft, light, stretchy, easy-to-layer fabric-colors are rich and versatile-since I am short, the crop goes right to my ankle, which makes them ideal for different occasions and shoes-true to sizeThe only drawback is that they can get wrinkly if not hung up and the wrinkles are stubborn.
review.name: Best. Pants. Ever.

review.reviewBody: I already had these pants in 2 other colors and just felt like I needed at least one more pair! Seriously, though, these pants are true to size and are SO comfy! They have plenty of flex without stretching out while wearing all day! Definitely a must have in everyone’s closet
review.name: Best pants ever🙌

review.reviewBody:
I was really stoked about hte se pants and wanted to like them but the fit is a huge disappointment. 

These are for you if you are an apple shape. I have a pear shape and the size that fits my legs and butt, has a huge gap in the waist and a droopy crotch. I tried a size 8 and 10. Normally wear an 8. The 8 was a bit snug in the legs. 10 I could move around better. BUT neither was very flattering looking, and also not comfortable. I need a belt to keep them up, and then they still droop in the crotch and the material around the waist bunches. For the money and hype, this is super disappointing and I will be returning them. I reached out to their customer service asking which pants would be more suited for my body type, and they basically said, go with overalls or those joggers with the elastic waist....
review.name: Disappointing fit

review.reviewBody: I was pretty excited about these, although they do fit a bit small. They fit well and move well, but after 4 months of using them for work I got a rip along the gusseted crotch line. Bummer.
review.name: Ripped through after 4 months of wear

review.reviewBody: I?ve had these pants a few months now, which I bought a few inches too long (because that was what was available at a discounted price from Backcountry). I don?t mind them cuffed one bit. They?re super comfy; I love the fit (not snug or baggy). They?re tough and durable. They broke in easily and wash up well. I love the design and all the pockets. Warm in (Michigan) winter without wool underneath.
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody: Pants fit great when I tried them on.  Love the gusseted crotch. Washed them after I got them, as I do all clothes before I wear them.... Zipper teeth fell apart on both pairs. Didn't even get to wear them!  Not happy I paid $90 pet pair for such low quality. Expected better.
review.name: Not good.

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket for walking the dog in the morning when there's still a cool breeze but you don't want a heavy jacket. Definitely recommend everyone have it in your arsenal - it's a great piece to keep in your car for beach days where you need something to keep the chill off as the sun sets or for early morning hikes. Fits true to size, has more of a regular fit where I could wear a long sleeve if I wanted to, but it has a little room.

review.reviewBody: As a tall guy (6'4"), it's hard to find a good fitting bib, so when I found this in medium/tall, I decided to give it a try. I loved the fit, all the pockets, and the insulation was just right with a thin base layer underneath. However, while wearing them on a snowy day, I quickly realized that the waterproofing was not even good enough to keep my behind dry on the lift, let alone if I had to sit down to strap on my board. On my second outing, I wore a Goretex layer underneath to keep the water from getting to me, but that ended up being ridiculously too warm. So, sadly, I returned them. If conditions are such that the weak waterproofing won't be an issue for you, go for this bib... I think you'll love it.
review.name: Love the fit. Hated getting wet.

review.reviewBody:
Just got the olive colorway bib in the mail and they're pretty sick! I'm about 5'7 150 lbs (athletic build) and the fit is almost perfect. My only complaint is that there is a TINY bit of restriction when I'm in a squatting position. The bib almost rides up my crotch area but thank goodness for the ventilation zippers!!! The bib provides plenty of extra room for other layers. I can fit an oversized hoodie for the warmer days on the mountain.

I will be taking these up to mammoth so we'll see how these hold up in the long run. Definitely coming back for the other colors! And huge s/o to Backcountry!! They came in really quick and I definitely plan on purchasing more items from you guys. Kudos!
review.name: Almost Perfect

hasVariant.name: Alpine Light 35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Alpine Light 35L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Nice bag, haven't taken it out yet but it will get a full testing on multiple peaks this winter. Couple of things that were weird. The belt I got is not the belt in the picture. One of the reasons I liked this older model was that the belt is white which stands out against my black jacket and A) is easier to quickly access and B) looks nicer. The pockets on the belt I received are black which is clearly not what is demonstrated in the picture. There's a lot of additional black piping and some buckles that are black and again, not what's pictured.

Fit wise it seems ok but I am a little concerned to put actual weight in it due to how the shoulder straps lay. I can't seem to find a position for the chest strap where it's tight enough to do anything AND doesn't pull the shoulder straps off of my body on the outside edge. Being a female with boobs probably doesn't help but I've never actually had this problem with a bag before so it's just odd. It seems like it will drive the inner edge of the shoulder straps into my chest which will end up being quite painful but I haven't tested it yet so not 100% sure.

The accessories like crampons loops, daisy chain, hook closure, pockets, zippers, etc all works as intended and seems well thought out.
review.name: Nice bag but not as pictured for some reason

review.reviewBody: As a mountain guide, I always look for lightweight and this pack is exactly that! All the features I need for ice climbing, including outside crampon straps.
review.name: Lightweight with all the features for ice climbing, including outside crampon straps.

review.reviewBody: Terribly designed inside and out. Attachment points for ice axe, terrible. Pack features, terrible. Even the color is useless. The white color of the pack blends right in with the snow up on the mountains. You’re just as well off carrying everything in a kitchen trash bag.
review.name: Not good and not a mountaineering pack

review.reviewBody: Very good pack overall. Some feature choices escape me. Why does an alpine climbing pack have fanny pockets on the waist belt? The belt should be bulk-free minimalist; and if anything have gear loops (… see the scramblers pack for hiking. No fanny pouches and gear loops). This midsize day pack would be better off with true top lid-pack rather than side pockets. I’m not a fan of the metal hook closure for the top. It can come undone too easily. The pack is no longer made of full spectra (now only 20% fibre). This is likely a cost saving measure. Enough complaining…. Living room loaded testing: the fit is excellent.
review.name: Very good

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack for ice season and have traveled and climbed with it a fair bit this winter. It is holding up well to airplane travel and being tossed around at the crags however the big reason for three stars is the fit. I ama 5'4, 120#, 'athletic build' (aka- climber shoulders) female and the pack straps are just too wide for comfort. Regardless of how much weight is in the pack, it is extremely uncomfortable and too wide in the shoulder unless I have the chest strap buckled to suck the straps in. A bit disappointing since I poured over reviews before buying. Hopefully this saves some smaller folks the trouble and shame on me for not trying on packs before buying!
review.name: Good bag, but small buyers take caution

review.reviewBody: Solid bag. I can hold a lot of gear in this bag with room to spare.
review.name: Performance

review.reviewBody:
I've used this pack for about a year. Rock climbing, alpine climbing and ski touring. Moderate use. It is my favorite pack. Not so many features that it's overwhelming, but all the features I want. I find it to be comfortable on long days and with a heavy load. You can really fit a lot inside and all the bits you want on the outside have good attachment points.

My only criticism is that care must be taken when storing ice tools (There's no worry when storing a normal ice axe, only water-ice tools). It looks like they might have changed this since I bought it, but the fabric used on my version (grey at the bottom) was easily ripped by the tools and more easily punctured. This doesn't happen when storing crampons on the front --- I really wrench those down and the material appears to be bomb proof. I feel like I will be (mostly) more careful stowing my ice tools now, but I have shortened the life of my pack a little, which is too bad because I like it so much.
review.name: Excellent pack for mountain adventures

name: Alpine Light 35L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love the color blocked pattern and that its cords, makes them a bit more every day than the lighter more hiking fabric of the other san juan overalls. Get tons of compliments and wish I could wear them every day!
review.name: So comfy and cute

review.reviewBody: Feel like these overalls are a good choice for daily wear fall & winter. Pretty well true-to-size but not generously cut. I like to cuff the hem up so they’re a little shorter.
review.name: Reasonably cute & comfy

review.reviewBody: These overalls looked super cute but when I got them, the actual colors were completely different than the photos. The darker side is a dark blue, not grey. The lighter side is brown, not pink. They were very comfy but wayyy too short in the legs. They ended mid calf and looked silly on me. For reference I am 5'8". Wanted to love but ended up returning.
review.name: Not what I was expecting

name: San Juan Overalls - Women's

review.reviewBody: Like walking on pillows. Has helped immensely with lower back pain. I am 75 years old, and wear these to the workout facility. My trainer is impressed
review.name: Eliminates lower back pain

review.reviewBody: I need these in wide please! Hoka, I've been saved by your shoes, mainly Bondis, but always need wide. Disappointed this isn't an option for the Skyward X
review.name: I want to purchase but...

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pairs of Hoka footwear. But these are the best one! Nice color, true size but the best part is that they are very comfortable! I work all day on my feet. My legs don't hurt no more, I recomend them,
review.name: Hoka best footwear!

review.reviewBody: I use my skyward X for work. I work all day on my feet, and they would hurt very much! Now with my Skyward X I don't feel any pain in my legs! Very comfortable and beautiful color!
review.name: Best footwear ever!

review.reviewBody: Beautiful colors and so comfortable. I would recommend this shoe to anyone wanting a comfortable shoe.
review.name: I would recommend these shoes to anyone

review.reviewBody: I bought these specifically for workouts on concrete. The cushioning is amazing. I felt like I had a little spring in my step. I am giving them a 4 because I really need a wider toe box. I usually wear Bondi 7's and 8's and prefer the wides. I exchanged the original pair for men's hoping they would be wide enough but they are still snug in the toe box. I would love these for all day wear if they were wider. The sole is amazing though.
review.name: I would buy again if they cam in wide

review.reviewBody: Love the cushion on this shoe especially when walking on hard floors. Makes my knees and back happy! I am a BondiSR fan , but these are even better! Great design HOKA!
review.name: cushy shoes

review.reviewBody: Loves this shoe, but I didn't get the support I needed in the toe box. My foot felt like it slid from side to side. I love the cushion of the shoe though. Guess il have to stick with the bondi.
review.name: Definitely the best.

review.reviewBody: My son recommended the Hoka shoes to me about 2 year's ago. These are the sixth pair of Hoka's I've purchased. And they are my ABSOLUTE FAVORITES thus far. I have really liked them all but, these are a step above the others. They extremely comfortable and supportive. I'm so in love with this shoe. I bought them in two colors.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: The plush cushioning provides more buffer between my feet and the ground.
review.name: Highly recommended!

name: Skyward X Running Shoe - Women's
